sen.j: 鉄砲方（てっぽうかた）は、江戸幕府の役職名。
sen.e: Teppokata was one of the posts of Edo bakufu.
Teppokata was one of the posts of Edo bakufu.
Teppokata was one of the posts of Edo bakufu.

sen.j: 鉄砲御用人、鉄砲御側衆とも。
sen.e: It was also called teppo goyounin or teppo osobashu.
It was also called teppo goyounin or teppo osobashu.
It was also called teppo goyounin or teppo osobashu.

sen.j: 鉄砲の研究、整備および修理を行った。
sen.e: It was a post to study, maintain and repair guns.
It was a post to study, maintain and repair guns.
It was a post to study, maintain and repair guns.

sen.j: 概要
sen.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 若年寄配下で、役料は200 - 300俵。
sen.e: It was subordinate of wakadoshiyori with yakuryo (executive allowance) of 200 – 300 bales.
It was subordinate of wakadoshiyori (a managerial position in Edo bakufu) with yakuryo (executive allowance) of 200 – 300 bales.
sen.cmt: a managerial position in Edo bakufu を追加
sen.e: It was subordinate of wakadoshiyori (a managerial position in Edo bakufu) with yakuryo (executive allowance) of 200 – 300 bales.

sen.j: 砲術の教授、鉄砲の製作、保存、修理を主な任務とし、イノシシやオオカミの打ち払い、火付や盗賊の逮捕にもあたった。
sen.e: The duties were instruction of gunnery, production, preservation and repair of guns as well as elimination of wild boars and wolves and to arrest robbers and arsonists.
The duties were instruction of gunnery, production, preservation and repair of guns as well as elimination of wild boars and wolves and to arrest robbers and arsonists.
The duties were instruction of gunnery, production, preservation and repair of guns as well as elimination of wild boars and wolves and to arrest robbers and arsonists.

sen.j: 担当
sen.e: Families in charge
Families in charge
Families in charge

sen.j: 江戸時代初期は、4家がその任に就いたが、後に井上家および田付家の2家による、世襲制となった。
sen.e: In the early Edo period, 4 families served as that, but later it took a hereditary system of Inoue family and Tatsuke family.
In the early Edo period, 4 families served as that, but later it took a hereditary system of Inoue family and Tatsuke family.
In the early Edo period, 4 families served as that, but later it took a hereditary system of Inoue family and Tatsuke family.

sen.j: 井上家
sen.e: Inoue family
Inoue family
Inoue family

sen.j: 砲術家で鉄砲製造技術に長けた井上正継を祖とする、外記流砲術を持つ。
sen.e: Masatsugu INOUE, a hojutsuka (ballistic specialist) who had excellent technique of gun manufacture was the founder of the family with gunnery of gaiki school.
Masatsugu INOUE, a firearms specialist who was also skilled in gun manufacturing, was the founder of Geki-style of artillery (Geki is another name for Masatsugu).
Masatsugu INOUE, a firearms specialist who was also skilled in gun manufacturing, was the founder of Geki-style of artillery (Geki is another name for Masatsugu).

sen.j: 代々、井上左太夫を名乗り、国産銃器を受け持つ。
sen.e: For generations the name Satayu INOUE was taken over and the charge was domestic firearms.
The name Satayu INOUE has been passed from one generation of the family to the next, and each of them has taken charge of firearms manufacturing in Japan.
sen.cmt: was→has been表現を変えました。原文に合わせて修正
sen.e: The name Satayu INOUE has been passed from one generation of the family to the next, and each of them has taken charge of firearms manufacturing in Japan.

sen.j: 田付家
sen.e: Tatsuke family
Tatsuke family
Tatsuke family

sen.j: 田付流砲術により、徳川家康に召し抱えられる。
sen.e: It was appointed by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA because of the gunnery of Tatsuke school.
The family was taken into the service of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, who thought highly of the Tatsuke style of artillery.
The family was taken into the service of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, who thought highly of the Tatsuke style of artillery.

sen.j: 輸入銃器（ほとんどがオランダ製）を受け持つ。
sen.e: The charge was import firearms (mostly made in the Netherlands).
The family has taken charge of import firearms (mostly made in the Netherlands).
The family has taken charge of import firearms (mostly made in the Netherlands).

sen.j: 稲富家
sen.e: Inatomi family
Inatomi family
Inatomi family

sen.j: 稲富祐直を始祖とする稲富流砲術を持つ。
sen.e: The founder was Sukenao INATOMI and it had gunnery of the Inadome school.
The founder was Sukenao INATOMI with the Inadome style of artillery.
The founder was Sukenao INATOMI with the Inadome style of artillery.

sen.j: 江戸時代初期に、銃砲術の改革を計って失敗し、番方に追われた。
sen.e: In the early Edo period, it tried to reform gunnery and failed and was demoted to bankata.
In the early Edo period, it tried to reform gunnery and failed and was demoted to bankata.
In the early Edo period, it tried to reform gunnery and failed and was demoted to bankata.

sen.j: 柘植家
sen.e: Tsuge family
Tsuge family
Tsuge family

sen.j: 鉄砲の妙手20人を連れ、関ヶ原の戦いに参戦。
sen.e: It participated in the Battle of Sekigahara with 20 gun experts.
It participated in the Battle of Sekigahara with 20 gun experts.
It participated in the Battle of Sekigahara with 20 gun experts.

sen.j: 配下
sen.e: Subordinates
Subordinates
Subordinates

sen.j: 御目見以下の鉄砲方与力、鉄砲方同心、鉄砲磨同心がいた。
sen.e: It had teppogata yoriki, teppogata doshin, teppomigaki doshin who were lower than omemi.
It had teppogata yoriki, teppogata doshin, teppomigaki doshin who were lower than omemi.
It had teppogata yoriki, teppogata doshin, teppomigaki doshin who were lower than omemi.

sen.j: 鉄砲方与力
sen.e: Teppogata yoriki
Teppogata yoriki
Teppogata yoriki

sen.j: 井上組、田付組に5名ずつ配属され、現米60石高。
sen.e: 5 people each were assigned to Inoue group and Tatsuke group respectively holding 60 kokudaka (a system for determining land value for tribute purposes in the Edo period).
5 people each were assigned to Inoue group and Tatsuke group respectively holding 60 kokudaka (a system for determining land value for tribute purposes in the Edo period).
5 people each were assigned to Inoue group and Tatsuke group respectively holding 60 kokudaka (a system for determining land value for tribute purposes in the Edo period).

sen.j: 鉄砲方同心
sen.e: Teppogata doshin
Teppogata doshin
Teppogata doshin

sen.j: 一組20人、30俵2人扶持。
sen.e: 20 people in one group with 30 bales 2 people fuchi (stipend) of salary.
20 people in one group with 30 bales 2 people fuchi (stipend) of salary.
20 people in one group with 30 bales 2 people fuchi (stipend) of salary.

sen.j: 鉄砲磨同心
sen.e: Teppomigaki doshin
Teppomigaki doshin
Teppomigaki doshin

sen.j: 田付組に所属し、定員12名、30俵2人扶持。
sen.e: They belonged to Tatsuke group with fixed number of people of 12 and 30 bales 2 people fuchi of salary.
They belonged to Tatsuke group with fixed number of people of 12 and 30 bales 2 people fuchi of salary.
They belonged to Tatsuke group with fixed number of people of 12 and 30 bales 2 people fuchi of salary.

sen.j: 幕府所蔵の鉄砲の全てを磨くことを役職とした。
sen.e: The duty was to polish all the guns in possession of bakufu.
The duty was to polish all the guns in possession of bakufu.
The duty was to polish all the guns in possession of bakufu.
